website_summaries.verdict: These lightweight and masterfully constructed CrossFit gloves offer tremendous durability.
pros: Neoprene delivers the perfect blend of comfort and support
Features Grip-Ridge technology that ensures the gloves will hold chalk to provide a firm grip
Intended for use by both men and women
cons: Gloves may cause the hands to sweat and provide minimal protection in comparison to similar options

customer_reviews.title: Too slippery for pull-ups, muscle-ups, and TTBs.
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of these at all. I don't know what people use these for, but they certainly do NOT help with pull-ups, muscle-ups, or TTBs. If you want to find something that helps with those, find something that has leather or carbon fiber. Someone at my gym said it best "It is like taking your workout shirt and putting it over the bar and trying to do pull-ups on it" Too slippery! Talk to people at your gym, and they will recommend something like Bear Komplex or picsil. I hope this saves someone else $40
customer_reviews.author: Keith P.

customer_reviews.title: Great product well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Love them. I crossfit 6 days a week and these really save my hands. They are true to size as long as you measure your hand right. They really feel like a second skin. And the wrist supports are great. I have seen previous comments complain about once you cut the finger holes you can't return them which is true but they really make it very simple if you measure your hand like they show on the instructions they will fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Little

customer_reviews.title: Good for wrist support but THAT'S IT
customer_reviews.text: I tried these this morning at Crossfit and was totally unimpressed. Workout included toes to bar so I was psyched to be able to focus more on getting my toes up than how badly my hands hurt, but I couldn't, because I slipped right off the bar. Of course you don't know this until you cut the little slits for your fingers otherwise you can't get them on your hand to even try them out - and then since you cut them you can't return them. Awesome. Chalk didn't help either. Since I'm out the $40 after not even one use, hopefully this will save someone else their money. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: [Review written after about a week worth of workouts] Make sure to measure you hand before purchase. Had to return the first pair and order a larger size. I purchased this particular product because I wanted hand protection and wrist wraps in the same package. This was absolutely a great buy. You can make the wrap as tight as you need. There is full/strong wrist support. I also use chalk with these. As long as you rinse it out after each use, there's no remnants of chalk, sweat, nor stink. Would absolutely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Company offers free jump rope for good reviews
customer_reviews.text: Basically this company included a note offering a free jump rope if you give it a 5 star review. I frankly find that unethical and misleading and for that reason alone, it's getting a 1 star review. That said, the WODies were a gift for my wife. She seemed please with them, but not overly so, as they did seem to bind a bit. So the true rating would probably be a 3. But do not be misled by the great reviews--those reviews have essentially been bought.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Young

customer_reviews.title: Cut your own holes
customer_reviews.text: This product is cheap and flimsy. I used it one time and it started falling apart, it didn't protect my hands ,my hands actually hurt worse with these versus bare-handed. I bought a different brand now that works great would not recommend these at all. On top of that the finger holes don't come with openings you have to cut the openings yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Davis

customer_reviews.title: and it's easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy these after I struggled to keep my Natural Grips in place. The WODies stay secured and don't bunch up. The material isn't cheap, and it's easy to clean. The only thing I don't like is that the WODies are advertised as a 2in1, but I don't get any wrist support from these because of the placement on the wrist is at the crease. Other than that, I really like how they function for movements that usually tear my hands, like pull-ups and kettle bell swings. I also use them on really heavy deadlifts because I prefer a double overhand grip.
customer_reviews.author: Dyl Pickle

customer_reviews.title: Still ripped!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for about a month and a half and am not satisfied with them. I followed the instructions verbatim and allowed adequate time to break them in ( 4-5x per week ) but still tore on pull-ups!! Gave them to a fellow box buddy to try and he was not to enthused with them either. However, in the quest for quality pull-up/muscle-up hand protection I was introduced to a company named Victory grips. My box owner allowed me try out his fingerless Victory stealth grips and WHAT A HUGE DIFFERENCE IN GRIP, FEEL AND COVERAGE!! Ordered a pair immediately!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamey South Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I waited about a month before reviewing these wraps. They definitely take some getting used to and I’m still not an expert at putting them on. Pay attention to the instructions and take the time to cut your finger holes to fit correctly. I like that this is a combo product so I don’t have to juggle wraps and gloves when I work out. This is an excellent solution and so far they have been very durable. I don’t use chalk, and they have held up Very well to sweaty palms. So far, I’m glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: HerdACD

customer_reviews.title: These DO NOT work for pull-ups or rig work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for CrossFit and they are HORRIBLE. They may work for other workouts but they don’t help grip the pull-up bar AT ALL. I jump up to grab the bar and immediately slip off. I have no idea why these are so highly rated. You have to cut the holes to fit your fingers and I covered them in chalk trying to improve the grip and save my skin so I have no clue if they can be returned.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect sizing!
customer_reviews.text: I never write product reviews, but I’m very disappointed in these grips. The sizing is completely incorrect. Bought these for my daughter and her hands measured WELL within the range of being a small. She can’t even fit the tips of her fingers through the holes - she ended up trying to cut bigger holes, but there isn’t even proper coverage over her palm. They look as though they were made for a toddler! Now I’m out the money I spent on these plus I’ll have to buy her a new pair that will actually fit her. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Expensive low end garbage. Sorry it’s true. You have to cut to fit and it is not really made to be cut. Too tight a fit as well. Ended up in the garbage before he had a chance to use it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hands ripped immediately
customer_reviews.text: Used for the 1st time today. Provide no grip whatsoever and my hands ripped before the workout was over. I’ve used cheaper gloves that worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Golfer

customer_reviews.title: WODies saved my hands for sure!
customer_reviews.text: Just finished my first Crossfit Games Open after starting Crossfit about 6 weeks ago. My WODies saved my hands for sure! I saw several people with ripped hands but mine never ripped. My calluses still took a beating but not once during the 5 workouts did I get a rip. I highly recommend WODies and the Nubs to go with them. i really never noticed I was wearing them, very comfortable. The only time I had to remove them was for HSPUs. I see no reason to rip up your hands, Crossfit workouts are painful enough, so wear WODies and go harder.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Little Bear

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Pair, Love these - 3 1/2 years on the first pair!
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered my second pair of WODies... after using my first pair for 3 1/2 years of constant Crossfit workouts! I realized they were finally worn out and my hands started getting more wear. I got the new pair and my first WOD in them had a lot of pullups, and they were so comfortable! I didn't have to break this pair in at all. Fantastic product for Crossfit. I wear them for every WOD. My size is right on the line of going to a medium, but I follow the advise to go to the smaller size and that works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Morrison

customer_reviews.title: So far, this is a great product
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased these new hand grip for working out and I haven't had a real good chance to test them out. I have a few weights at home and I have been pleased with the comfort and support. I am still reviewing them and If I find any additional that would be helpful to anyone I will post more at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Decent not amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm rating 3 out of 5 for 1 simple reason. While on the bar for t2b and pull-ups, these slipped (after I had rubbed the chalk block on the fabric and my hands as well as under the fabric and fingers) to my fingers and failed to hold the bar. I don't know if it's because of these grips but it felt as though it was easier than usual to hold on with just fingers, but the bar was not in my palm. Nevertheless, these are good for barbell work and I can see them helping keep off calluses but I would need a grip that keeps the bar in my palm instead of in my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Jones

customer_reviews.title: Today I tried these for the first time for a WOD and they were simply fantastic. They gave the proper palm coverage and felt ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a Crossfit Coach and have tried what seems to be every grip out there. Including Reebok Crossfit Gloves, Gripads. The Gripper gloves, Jaw Palm Guards and many others. Each one either had too much padding, not enough padding, bunched up, didn't work with chalk etc. Today I tried these for the first time for a WOD and they were simply fantastic. They gave the proper palm coverage and felt like I had nothing between my hand and the bar. They didn't bunch up and the wrist wrap support was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K

customer_reviews.title: Great product that works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. I've been doing Crossfit for a year and five months. These are great when you have WODs with a lot of pull ups. They also work great as wrist straps. The straps are comfortable once broken in. Definitely follow the directions as far as cutting the holes tight. I almost made the holes bigger, but like the instructions say, after three of four workouts the holes stretch and fit better. Ripping used to be a big concern for me. Which transferred to less confidence on the bar. These help alleviate that concern.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Loyed

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! My first pair last for about 3 years before I bought this second set. I bought the same brand and style just a different color. Follow the included instructions for cutting the finger holes. Really durable with every day wear. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it BUT...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome, I have been using these almost every day. I end up using them without palm protection, just tuck the palm part in while wrapping it just on wrist for wrist support. My only concern was that my palm does not get covered fully. I have medium size thin hands and palm protection is 0.5inch small at MD size, unlike what picture shows.
customer_reviews.author: RedBird

customer_reviews.title: Meeting my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with these grips so far. I bought them primarily for wrist support when lifting above my head and for that they have worked wonders! My wrists don't hurt at all anymore. My secondary purpose for the grips was palm protection and they have worked great - my blisters are healing. I haven't yet had an opportunity to use them for pull-ups, c2b, t2b activities so I can't comment on their grip in this but the grip has been perfectly fine on the barbell with chalk. Overall this product is checking all the boxes!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica W MacGinnis

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit, like the wrist support
customer_reviews.text: I do like that these have the wrist support as part of the grip. I don't like that they are very thin. I still find that I can rip my hands while using these. Especially when doing a lot of bar work. They fit nicely but the finger holes do take some time to become comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good product but think about the seams in the palms.
customer_reviews.text: The wrist support works great and they are comfortable for the whole workout. The seams on the palm protection are too thick. They saved my hands but started to ware a new place under the seams. I am getting used to them and my skin has not broke under the seams, but it is distracting.
customer_reviews.author: Wynter

customer_reviews.title: These work great! I chalked both sides heavily (bar and palm ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great! I chalked both sides heavily (bar and palm sides) and didnt have any slippage the first time i tried them. Does a great job at high rep bar work, like pull ups, toes-to-bar, snatches, thrusters, etc. The wrist wraps can be tightened or loosened depending on the workout. Like others have said, cut the fingers holes little by little and try them on with each snip to get the propper size. Not hard, just takes a lil time. I used small scissors as well to help ensure presice cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product to protect your hands when lifting!
customer_reviews.text: Great wrist straps! I'm a female and somewhat new to weight lifting, I use these primarily for lifting, I'm not a crossfitter but I do have mad respect for them! The wrist strip and palm cover is very support for my wrists and it was nice that I could make the finger holes as large as I needed (my fingers are bigger). Sometimes, I take the palm cover off just so that I can have the wrist support and they work great! I would recommend these to any one wanting to protect their hands when weight lifting and have some wrist support.
customer_reviews.author: Hiliary

customer_reviews.title: Love these grips!
customer_reviews.text: Jerkfit WODies are the best for hand protection against rips and for wrist support! My first pair lasted a year and I'm on my second pair. I've tried a few other kinds of wrist wraps/grips and these are the best! I have grip strength issues and these are thin enough to feel the bar and they don't interfere with gripping the bar either. I have very small hands and the small is perfect. Will definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Recent purchase only used a couple times to date. They seem to be well made and offer great support in the wrist and palm areas. I’m happy with performance so far, but have only used them a few times. 2 other people I know use them and had recommended them to me, so at this time I would also recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Sammigirl

customer_reviews.title: Seems Fine
customer_reviews.text: Ok I guess. Have only used once. More slippery on the bar than I expected (beginner), wondering if I'm worse off with them. Also, I think I bought slightly too big, despite measuring as instructed. I was on the cusp so should have sized down, not up. I got these mainly for the wrist supports since the leather gymnast grips (which I also bought) have a narrow wrist strap. These seem fine, but haven't really used enough to say.
customer_reviews.author: Ma Reeny

customer_reviews.title: It's just okay.  Recommendation depends on your needs.
customer_reviews.text: Bottom Line: They're just okay. Good for basic palm protection and wrist support; horrible for grip (especially when doing pull-ups/muscle-ups). The palm protector is not leather, but a synthetic cloth of some sort. This makes it nice and thin (if you don't like bulky), but also make it nice and slippery when you're trying to do something on a high bar. Wrist support is great though, and you can fold down the palm protector (to get it out of the way) if/when you only need wrist support.
customer_reviews.author: Hank T.

customer_reviews.title: Good,  but painful break in
customer_reviews.text: They feel really tight at first, and I had to open up the the holes at the finhers quite a bit, the couple couple of times they actually hurt to use, but per their instructions they need to be broken in, I was having problems ripping my skin open in the middle of my Palm, this took care of that, and the wrist support is pretty good, I just fold the hand part back whenever I don't need it and voila! I would've given 5 stars but the break in period was actually painful, I would recommend these if ripping open in the middle of your Palm like myself, and use a lot of chalk like it says! Overall, good.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with these grips. The palm protection is minimal because the lycra (?) is so thin. I use these for trapeze and I each time I use them, I get wounds on my palms so I might as well be not wearing grips at all. I don't see any benefit over the leather grips I had, especially given the high price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Panzera

customer_reviews.title: New to Crossfit
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to cross fit, within 3 weeks I realized wrist straps and protection were needed. These provide the right amount of coverage and support. Haven’t been using them long enough to speak on longevity but other reviews say these are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: NOT good for pullups...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these primarily to protect my hands while on the bar (pullups, T2B, etc.). They are horrible for that, unless you have an iron grip already. Just slid right off. However, the wrist support is great and I do like them and use them for lifting of any sort. So they aren't a total loss. If you're looking for grips for the bar, I'd suggest those from WOD Nation, which are the best I've ever tried.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Go into these knowing you have to cut the finger holes and that’s scary. I was so nervous to make them too big that they are too small and I refuse to cut more. You can’t try them on without cutting but as soon as you cut you can’t return.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Peach

customer_reviews.title: Good for Crossfit.
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to Crossfit (8 months) and these work great to save you hands from anything hanging (pull ups, toes to bar, etc) and your wrists from heavy lifts. Also not distracting enough that you would need to take them off between movements mid-WOD. I’m only rating 4/5 because I have nothing to compare it to.
customer_reviews.author: Max Powers

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: These things a pretty cool. They take a little getting used to. The palm protector is fabric, not leather. You have to break them in, as the directions say. Pack them with chalk as much as possible. The wrist supports are very stiff and I happen to like that. Was a little surprised that you have to cut your own finger holes, bit it does make them somewhat "custom".
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel D. Roach

customer_reviews.title: Bunches up after few pull-ups
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use it for Pull ups and Muscle ups but it didn't work for me as it bunches up after few reps. Can't stay on bar for more than 10 reps. It's good for short workouts but for lengthy workouts I wouldn't recommended these. So I occasionally use them when my hands get teared because of calluses.
customer_reviews.author: Naveen-suji

customer_reviews.title: Great grip and protection
customer_reviews.text: Best solution I have found for holding onto the bar and also not tearing callouses. If you have large fingers carefully cut your finger holes or you may end up with one giant hole.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Reduces hand and wrist pain.  Wish I would have purchased sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I put these to the test yesterday and they worked great on the pull-up bar. They reduced my hand fatigue and reduced the typical soreness I get after doing pull ups (I'm 200 lbs so my hands get sore doing pull ups). Today I put the wrist guard feature of the Wodies to work with Power cleans and Jerks and I thought they offered sufficient support. I typically have pain when I do cleans and with these I had no pain. I like that the Wodies can be used for a wide variety of lifts.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: These things are perfect. They have absolutely saved my hands
customer_reviews.text: These things are perfect. They have absolutely saved my hands. The illustration is a little chalk (aka "gym crack") excessive, so ignore that. The wrist support is a big help too. They are especially helpful for front squats where there is a lot of pressure on the wrist. They are the best thing ever for pullups and related movements. There are some movements where they are a hinderance, like push ups and burpees so like any tool they aren't the right thing for all jobs. Still... I'm very very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sean R. Mclean

customer_reviews.title: 2 in 1 can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine working out without these things anymore. I orginally bought them for the the protection of my hands and the wrist straps turned out to be the best part! They are durable as hell and I have been using them for about a month now.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Really like these I use these for crossfit size in length was good but I wish they were about 1/2 wider had them about 2 months and have held up also they have kinda thick trim or hem on the side wish they were thinner or more flush I guess
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Crossfit
customer_reviews.text: What I didn't expect was to love the wrist stability included in this product. I bought them in tandem with the nubs and really enjoy them! I've used them for a year. I hand wash and air dry and all the chalk and stinky sweat seems to come right off. Perfect for Toes to Bar, Pull Ups, or really any WOD! I wear them for almost every workout 5-6 days a week. They are even labeled "Right/Left." If I could give these 6 stars I would!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua O.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for about 3 weeks and I just can't get them comfortable enough to use during crossfit. I like the wrist supports incorporated into the palm protectors but these aren't for me. I know others a the gym LOVE them. I will continue to use them as needed but I bought another pair of leather gymnastic wraps for heavier work at Crossfit. My palms are still getting blisters & I've tried without chalk, with chalk, and continuously reapplying. None seems to work for me. Great quality product without a doubt. I wish they did work for me. I will use them for olympic lifting only.
customer_reviews.author: Alli Pie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Wrist support isn’t bad but the actual hand protection is nothing more than a piece of cloth. The finger holes were so small on a medium that it I tried to widen them if end up with one large hole. These would work for a light workout but not for anything heavy or grueling. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Best grips ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing Crossfit for well over a year now and have tried a few different pairs of grips/wrist wraps. These are the best I've tried by far. I've had problems gripping the bar with other gloves but the design of these works flawlessly. They protect my hands but allow me to grip the bar really well. The wrist support is better than the others I've used too. Update: These things are still amazing. Great quality. Just ordered another pair for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Johnson

customer_reviews.title: They are sturdy and supportive so they work well for lifting but ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using these WODies for a couple of months now. Purchased when started Crossfit based on positive reviews. The product claims to minimize or eliminate ripping. Thought 2-in-1 would be the way to go. They are sturdy and supportive so they work well for lifting but it seems the material covering the palms is too thin and has not prevented ripping even after a few months of wearing them in, and the wraps ride up out of place during the gymnastics rig movements. Might be good for beginners or those not planning to do much in the gymnastic movements. Again, good for lifting but not so much for anything else Crossfit related. Looking into separate wrist wraps and hand grips.
customer_reviews.author: BBage

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! can't imagine not using them now
customer_reviews.text: I took a break from crossfitting for 9 months so my hands had gotten softer and my calluses smaller. Coming back to doing regular WODs again I started ripping constantly. I bought these after seeing someone else use them to try them out. They have been great so far and I now use them all the time. I haven't ripped since buying them and no longer have to grind down my calluses periodically. They glide with the bar when doing lifts and they are light to where they don't get in the way when using a pullup bar or rings like other gymnast type hand wraps I have used in the past which were a lot bulkier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Finger holes are a tight fit, have to wear them in a bit. I think these are designed well, but I wasn't a fan of the material. I was afraid of slipping on the bar. I have since switched to leather grips and find that those give me more of a hold on the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla Beuch

customer_reviews.title: Grip part is too thin and slippery, cant return after cut out finger holes
customer_reviews.text: I liked the wrist support but that was it, the palm part is so thin and slippery to do pull ups or toes to bar, I think 40 dlls is way too much for what this is, I have a pair of 10 dlls one the work 10 times better To try them on you have to cut out the finger holes so they fit and you cant return them if you cut out the holes, so pretty much this is a final sale regardless if you like them or not because how else will you know until you try them out
customer_reviews.author: Heriberto G.

customer_reviews.title: So far this has been the best protection for my hands and it is even better ...
customer_reviews.text: I am always looking for any protection for my hands because I crossfit 3-5 times a week. So far this has been the best protection for my hands and it is even better because it also gives you wrist support. When I wear other gloves I would lose grip because the palms get sweaty making pull-ups harder. I even used the special tapes for hands but they would not endure the whole WOD. I just bought my second pair because the first pair I got about 2 years has a whole in the middle. I still use the one with a hole but I just wanted to have a second pair. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: The grips are life....well ummmm HAND savers! I am a nurse who does CrossFit. I want to keep my hands soft, so they don't feel like sandpaper when I am assessing patients. These grips are the bomb! As for reviews complaining about fit, just follow the instructions and measure your hand properly and you'll be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: CodyAnn

customer_reviews.title: Improved WODS
customer_reviews.text: I have completed more WODS because of you. I was using tape before but these are much better for your hands. I have let a few use them only for them to go out and buy a pair. Great support in the wrist and protection in the hand. I think you should order a size smaller than you think as they will stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love my WODies! This is my 2nd pair; they provide great hand protection and wrist support. I have arthritis in my thumb joints, and these really make it possible for me to continue to lift without hand pain.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love these! I'm hooked on them and won't do a WOD without them. I've bought a few different types of hand protection for blisters and this has been the best. As long as you buy the right size, you will like way save your hands from rips and tears. You'll get used to the material between your fingers fairly quickly. I haven't blistered my hands since I've purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Whan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: These grips are contructed very solidly however, i was very unimpressed with material used for the hand grip. It has a slippery neophrene type texture. The "grips" actually worstened my grip resulting in me accidentally throwing a barbell across the room while doing a wod with power cleans. They really should be made out of leather or canvas. I've since gone back to using my bare hands and putting up with the rips and calluses instead.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Cook

customer_reviews.title: Buy it if you have have nothing but bones and skin. Otherwise they won’t fit.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst purchase ever. I ordered medium(which is the right size according to their chart)and it doesn’t fit right, puts so much pressure on my fingers. Don’t waste your money and invest in something else.. all these 5 stars are so misleading. My fingers aren’t fat but I could hardly wear it with pain and I’m not working out with red fingers. GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Adiya Akhmetova

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately cut too much i didnt even apply much pressure
customer_reviews.text: Barely cut the hole and it got damaged so quick and now cannot use and it says once cuts have been made no return, just wasted my money I can't use this, I barely cut it and it opened up like that
customer_reviews.author: Jassim Al-oboudi

customer_reviews.title: Best grips on market for bar work.
customer_reviews.text: Best grips on market. I train bar work 3-4 times a week and these are the only ones that have held up with no tearing and maintain shape. Strong Velcro. Nice to have some wrist support bu my main function is protect the hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Sewell

customer_reviews.title: May be great for you (not for me)
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like these gloves but after using my hands would chafe from the sweat which made it more uncomfortable to wear even for short crossfit workouts
customer_reviews.author: Stoll

customer_reviews.title: So far I really like these gloves
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like these gloves. The only thing is I have to take them off when doing thing like pushups and long arm planks because when I have to bend my hands back the wrist band is so stiff it hurts. But for pull up bar, bicep curl, tricep and leg exercises like deadlifts these are great and stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie W

customer_reviews.title: Too slippery
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with these. Mine are too small, but would be manageable if they weren’t so slippery! I’ve had to take them off in the middle of every wod because im sliding off bars. I’ve tried chalk and nothing will add enough texture. Very sad.
customer_reviews.author: Christine A.

customer_reviews.title: Two-in-one
customer_reviews.text: I used to have to wear wrist wraps and fingerless gloves during WODs that included pull-up type movements and front squats. As luck would have it, I lost my gloves so I had to find something to replace them. I ended up finding WODies and I couldn't be happier after using them during several workouts, not to mention it's a little less hassle since I don't have to don gloves and wrist wraps before a WOD. I definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Edward L Umali

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment!
customer_reviews.text: I used my one pair for the years! Just reupped to a new color. They've worked great for me and protect my hands most of the time. Nothing can completely stop tearing, but it is far and few between when wearing these. They are great with snatches and other activities that have heavy involvement. I would buy them a million times over. I've tried many gloves and these are what I stand by!
customer_reviews.author: nicholas brown

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. works for different workouts
customer_reviews.text: Works for pull ups, wrist support too. Thickness is optimum not too less, not too thick. Gives great grip. the only thing i didn't like was support for palm callus during pull ups, it slids down some times and does not give support as required. you have to stop, re position and then start again.
customer_reviews.author: dipal panchal

customer_reviews.title: These are the best gloves I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I have been working out for many years. These are the best gloves I have owned. Very minimal material in the palm area. Does not bunch up In the hand. The wrist straps are a added plus. Don't need sepereate wrist straps and palm grips. THIS IS ALL IN ONE.
customer_reviews.author: martin rostami

customer_reviews.title: Good product just not the right size for me.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say that these met or did not meet my expectations as I've not used them. As soon as I opened up the package I knew that the medium wad too small for me. I'm waiting to see if someone from my gym wants them and I'll pick up the larges. Other wise I'll be returning them for the large size. I'm not sure is the advise of ordering smaller if you are on the cusp is the right advise as it wasn't for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R Walter

customer_reviews.title: No tears since I got these!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many other CrossFit grips for my hands, and none of them felt as comfortable or effective as these ones. I wear these for my pull-ups and muscle-ups. I haven't had a rip once yet (been a few months since wearing these)!
customer_reviews.author: Lieblingsfarbe

customer_reviews.title: These kind of suck.
customer_reviews.text: It’s sad because I was really excited to use these but when I actually did the only benefit they provided was wrist support. The whole palm cover is so thin that your hands will hurt more when you use them. I tried on three separate occasions during three different workouts to use them and they actually did nothing but make it worse. Don’t waste your money on these. Get some that have a leather palm cover or something more durable. You’ll definitely regret getting these.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gloves with great wrist support
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of research online to find the best CrossFit gloves to fit my needs, I decided for these ones and I can honestly say they are great and doing what they are supposed to do. I bought the small size but I think I should’ve gone with the medium size because they are a little snug but I was afraid the medium size was going to be to big. I love the wrist support and the fact that my hands aren’t getting destroyed anymore :)
customer_reviews.author: Denise Nunez

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: I need some to cover my pinkie as well...hint hint Jerkfit. I did 84 chest to bars alternating with 84 heavy dumbbell snatches on sunday and these saved my hands...except for the small rip on the pinkie which the Wodie does not cover. Not their fault
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Got this for a secret santa
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a secret santa. Unfortunately it was the wrong size. Didn't get to exchange it
customer_reviews.author: mrbeastk

customer_reviews.title: Great grip - 10x better than bear complex
customer_reviews.text: These are so much better than bear complex. I didn’t see how u would have grip with these but the material is amazing and chalk up great. I wish I would’ve went with these first before the bear complex. Those were a waste.
customer_reviews.author: TMN

customer_reviews.title: More confidence when lifting.
customer_reviews.text: My hands sweat profusely which makes me push less through a workout for fear of flinging or dropping weights. The sizing chart was accurate and I received them earlier than estimated. Well made and great support in the wrist. Helps a lot with my grip.
customer_reviews.author: PA Dutch Girl

customer_reviews.title: I really like these... I've worked up my whole life and used ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like these... I've worked up my whole life and used the regular wrist strap with the thumb strap to hold on as you wrap with Velcro... I was sick of those and needed something different and new... These do not replace my versa grip straps for back day but works for everything else... I really enjoy using these and people ask where did I get them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for wrist support and gymnastics work!
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of WODies lasted a year and a half of 5-6 days a week of use and weekly washing (hang dry). That is incredible!! Just ordered a new pair and can’t imagine Crossfitting without these. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: RCM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: New into the Crossfit world I quickly realized I needed to save my hands! These hand and wrist protectors have been amazing. I am able to hold onto the bar much better and longer without slipping as easily and the band for wrist support helps with the lifting as well :) Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Protection and Wrist wrap!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third pair. I really like them. They last me about 9 months of using them in Crossfit about 4 times a week. They could be a little less expensive or a little more durable. Just behind the fingers is where they usually wear down.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: You have to cut your own finger holes to size.
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve used the WODies just a handful of times. I love them. They’re comfortable and I don’t slip while on the rig. They aren’t bulky and distracting. The reason I didn’t give them 5 stars is because you have to cut your own finger holes. I like that it gives you a very custom fit but at the same time figuring out what really works takes a few times of uncomfortable workouts because once you cut them you can’t go back.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Figured everything in one was a great idea. That and the fact you can wash ...
customer_reviews.text: So recently purchased for crossfit. Figured everything in one was a great idea. That and the fact you can wash them, sweat like crazy especially on my hands. While I love the wrist wrap part. The grip part I’m not in love with. Used lots of chalk like they said but my hands still got beat up pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: kelly cribb

customer_reviews.title: Still get calluses
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn these to CrossFit 3 or 4 times, but I'm still getting calluses on my hands, even while wearing them. They are comfortable, but not providing much protection.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Measurement didnt work, can return after open
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a Large and a small for me and my mom after we did the measurements when we tried them on they felt tight so we cut them to help them fit better, and they still were too small, lost the money because they don't accept returns after being cut.
customer_reviews.author: LauraSt

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: I was having issues with wrist support and one of my Crossfit fam let me try their WODies and they made an immediate impact on my lifting ability while helping me advance my mobility. I came home right away and ordered. Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Have had good luck with these gloves. Protects my hands, good grips. Easy to wash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best wrist wraps I’ve owned. The palm protector is great when doing movements where the bar can tear up your hands. So good someone took my first pair at my gym. Can’t wait to break in my second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner S.

customer_reviews.title: Replacing my OG pair
customer_reviews.text: Although I wish they were tougher or less slick, I'm addicted to them. They save my palms from ripping at crossfit and they are the only set that fit my tiny hands.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: Very Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical thinking the synthetic/fabric like material can provide both protection and grip. I can say that everyone who raved about them is correct. These hand grips worked extremely well while giving your hand the dexterity and ability to work on your grip strength.
customer_reviews.author: YBH

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Average hand protection. Mostly for barbell work. Forget about pull up rig.
customer_reviews.author: Oana-Maria

customer_reviews.title: Finally. A miracle for my hands
customer_reviews.text: Tore ALL the time until WODies. I tried just about everything else out there, then I found these. Feels like a decent amount of wrist support for workouts with pull-ups and lifts. But I'm more interested in not ripping my calluses off which is now no longer a concern. Just cut the finger holes judiciously and don't go too much at first. But equally don't skimp or you'll wind up with blue fingers. Finally found the right cut and with some chalk, these have been golden.
customer_reviews.author: KE

customer_reviews.title: An excellent overall Crossfit choice!
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly as described and the flexible "grippy" material is the envy of my other crossfit buds who use the more rigid grips. I was immediately pleased with full palm protection when performing the dreaded kipping pull-ups which can be a quick way to a nasty rip, but was surprised by how sturdy the wrist wraps were! I was able to put aside my wrist wraps when doing WOD's that incorporate weightlifting and rig work - - the WODies do it all for me! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: ChuckM

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning these. Sizing was off, even though I followed the scale. And I wasn’t sold on how the fabric palm would hold up. I ended up ordering a different brand with leather palms. Love those.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Superb wrist support, quality material and well made.  5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this purchase. The wrist support is superb. The fit is good (large). The finger hole precut slits ate easy to customize. The palm protection works well. Overall these seem to be made well and with quality materials. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Estorchez

customer_reviews.title: Good for barbell
customer_reviews.text: These do not prevent tearing for T2B or pullups. They are awesome for barbell workouts due to wrist support, but pinches and tears during rig exercises, almost better to use nothing for t2b than these. 5 stars for just barbell work though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect. Need bigger finger holes
customer_reviews.text: Provides good wrist support and palm protection while not restricting my grip. The only down side is the small finger holes. I have small fingers but the holes were small despite cutting the webbing to make a little extra room
customer_reviews.author: VDo

customer_reviews.title: These work really well. I was careful to cut ...
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. I was careful to cut the finger holes after I read the reviews. My slits are holding up well with no additional stretching. I literally cut the smallest incisions possible until I got the correct circumference for my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Horn

customer_reviews.title: Grossly overpriced
customer_reviews.text: These are basically a $10 pair of wrist wraps with an extra few square inches of material sewn on. I can't imagine that they cost more than a few dollars to manufacture. What's more, I didn't find that they particularly helps with padding on bar work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for your workout bag!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to bust these bad boys out for a workout today, and they more than delivered comfort and support for TTBs, power cleans, and push press. Great coverage of my palm and comfortable material. Amazing support of my wrists - due to a few broken metacarpals from my football days there is more discomfort when I’m cleaning or pressing heavier weight - these made a HUGE difference. And moving between the pull-up bar and the barbell was seemless. Great product! Get it in your bag!
customer_reviews.author: John Megaro

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable in the palm and great wrist support
customer_reviews.text: The wrist support was key for me. The WODies have what seemed liked the most stable wrist wrap and they did not disappoint. I'm in my 40's. I've had plenty of broken and sprained injuries, and these are terrific from a stability standpoint. I usually wear wraps on higher weigh exercises and these just allow me to stick with one wrap for my CF workouts. And no leather and weird smell - from what I hear, that's a killer. Super happy with these. Totally recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: NO GRIP AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: These are bulky and do not grip at all. Its like wrapping a towel around the bar and trying to do pull ups/ other crossfit movements. I slipped right off even with massive amounts of chalk. Not to mention even when you cut the holes to max available room they still cut off the circulation in my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: chris schmitt

product_meta.title: JerkFit WODies Hand Grips with Wrist Wraps for Weightlifting, Pull-Ups, Cross Training, WODs, and Gymnastics, Prevent Blisters and Rips, for Men and Women
feature_bullets: ✅PALM PROTECTING + WRIST SUPPORT: Full Palm protection and Wrist Support combined in one product. WODies Grips are the all-around utility glove to be used on ALL movements from the pull up rig to the barbell. And thanks to the built in wrist wraps, WODies provide extra wrist support for those heavy lifts. ***PLEASE MEASURE YOUR HAND USING THE 6TH PHOTO BEFORE ORDERING. DO NOT GUESS

✅COMFORTABLE: WODies provide a "natural glide" to absorb friction away from your hands and on to the material. And unlike leather grips, WODies cause absolutely zero bunching or painful pinching. Resiliently built to withstand the toughest of workouts. These top quality grips will last! Perfect for powerlifting, bodybuilding, calisthenics, cross fitness and HIIT training.

✅PROUDLY 100% MADE IN AMERICA with the finest, and most premium materials available. WODies are the training equipment you need to lift more, reduce injury, increase the duration of your workouts, and reduce wrist and forearm fatigue with these incredible workout gloves.

✅BUILT TO LAST: Heavy-Duty built-in supportive wrist brace gives you the extra confidence to push harder. WODies palm material is extremely durable and absorbs sweat and chalk to keep your hands dry and increase grip and built to withstand a serious amount of abuse.

✅ MULTI-PATENTED, 2-in-1 DESIGN: Used by Hundreds of thousands of athletes worldwide who wouldn’t train without them, there is nothing even close. These extremely well made adjustable wrist straps for weight lifting are the most diverse gloves you’ll ever use.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
